DataElement.preferredName: Intravenous Route of Administration Contrast Agent Test Dosing Unit Bolus Infusion Procedure Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication of whether or not a test bolus infusion dose was administered intravenously.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Agents Domain Intravenous Route of Administration Contrast Agent Test Dosing Unit Bolus Infusion Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure._Administration within or into a vein or veins._Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue._A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) needed to assess or examine the (potency of the) substance being used._A procedure in which a single dose of a pharmalogical substance is administered, generally via injection, over a short period of time._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Concepts.definition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Property.preferredName: Intravenous Route of Administration Contrast Agent Test Dosing Unit Bolus Infusion Procedure Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Administration within or into a vein or veins.:Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.:A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) needed to assess or examine the (potency of the) substance being used.:A single dose of a drug or other substance given over a short period of time. It is usually given by infusion or injection into a blood vessel. It may also be given by mouth.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug within or into a vein or veins. Introduction of the drug directly into venous circulation results in 100% bioavailability due to an absence of the absorption phase, provides a precise and continuous mode of drug therapy, especially for drugs with a narrow therapeutic index.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.
A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) needed to assess or examine the (potency of the) substance being used.
A procedure in which a single dose of a pharmalogical substance is administered, generally via injection, over a short period of time.
Executed and carried through to completion.
